data.title: Great breakfast prices
data.text: Always hit this place for their breakfast specials. Always great and fast service! The staff is very friendly and portions are good.

data.title: To stay or not to stay that is the question
data.text: I have been coming to this restaurant in a regular for quite some time. When I first started coming here I was overwhelmed with the kindness the generosity the friendliness and the quality of the food for the price. But over the last year I have noticed a significant change. Not in the waitresses or the service but in the quality of the food and the prices... It started out you got a really nice breakfast $1.99... you didn't go away hungry... But I'll admit you were over filled either... Now $3.99 you're lucky if you get a good smell of the food.. The cooks in the back is pretty much taken control of the restaurant... They cook the food the way they want it... I like my toast cook on the grill because it doesn't get dried out so bad. Now they refuse to do that because they claim that it takes way too long. If you order your eggs medium, they come back burned around the edges and on the bottom... If you complain that's just all it is complain... They continue to do things the way they want to do.... The only thing that keeps me coming back here is the ladies that work here, they are the best waitresses I've ever seen, one in particular.... Her name is Rhonda... She meet you at the door or at your table and makes you feel like your family and she hasn't seen you in forever... Always has a smile on her face... This lady is the queen of waitresses in my opinion.... Stop by give it a try and ask for her, Rhonda.... I hope this benefits you, and deciding a place to have a good breakfast...

data.title: The food is home cooked and really good.
data.text: I eat here as often as I can, when I'm looking for a home cooked meal. Their breakfast is big enough for two, so come hungry.

data.title: Think of "Cheers" hello.....friendly, family place. Great value. seniors Specials
data.text: First stopped for breakfast...price starting at $1.99.... Breakfast skillet is Huge.  Lunch and dinner affordable and home cooked. Lots and lots of regular diners daily prove what a great meal at a fair price....Friday specials include fish and chips and a great prim rib (for the price).  last night after a long day of painting, stopped in with an appetite.....ordered the Greek combo, but didn't read the description....the meal includes do  Greek salad, gyro, spinach pie, rice pilaf, and veggie..portion more than generous for two people...and dinner comes with dessert...come join us and hug the owner who is there every day...7 days a week...7AM til 9 PM

data.title: Yummy Breakfast
data.text: Fast and Hot, this place is really good.  I had breakfast there, was just the way I like it and more than I can eat.  Scrambled eggs, sausage, biscuit and gravy...under $5. Coffee cup was never empty, never had to search for my server, I couldn't ask for more.  Very homey and welcoming. I want to go back for lunch or dinner or both...

data.title: Family breakfast
data.text: I had breakfast on my first full day in Michigan with my family here as it was highly recommended by my mother in law. The staff were so polite and friendly, the restaurant itself is larger than the outside seems. The food was very good. They were very good with our baby and the coffee kept on coming.

data.title: Breakfast is fantastic!
data.text:
Fast, affordable, friendly and great food!
The restaurant is on Ford Rd. It is a small restaurant, but has amble seating. The building is older, but don't let that keep you away. The food is home cooked and served hot! Large servings, and an owner who checks on her customers! Waitresses are extremely friendly, and make you feel right at home!
Breakfast specials are the best, however with the variety of menu choices, any item you select will taste great.
A definite stop if you're in Westland, MI.

data.title: Great for breakfast or simple dinner
data.text:
You can tell this is a family run place!  The woman  who hugs you while smiling certainly has to be the owner!  She's here 7 days a week. 
Dinner comes with soup or salad and some dessert!
great old fashioned value!

data.title: Fast, friendly, good food
data.text: Our family goes here mostly for their week day breakfast special (eggs, meat, hashbrowns and toast). You can't beat $1.99. The food is good and the service very good (family owned and operated). Not the fanciest place in town, but very welcoming. We have also had the Greek salad and fish fry on Fridays, both very good. Their chicken noodle soup is also delicious. Can be very crowded in the mornings during the week, wait is usually not too long.

data.title: The name fits this place
data.text: We eat here on a regular basis. I think it is a very nice place to eat with your family. Yes it is old and could use some repairs and updating however I feel so at home when I go there, we are always met with a smile and a hug and welcome. The food is plentiful, and the taste satisfies me. If you're looking for a 5-star review, then you need to look elsewhere, this is a great place with a great prices and great food . I would recommend this to anyone. Where else can you find a full breakfast for $1.99. NO WHERE !

data.title: Below average diner
data.text: Service is fast and friendly, but the food is not very good. Hamburger patty tasted as if it had been frozen a good while, and the salad was simply a bowl of iceberg lettuce and a tiny, bland tomato slice. Mashed potatoes were likely from a box. Some seats and tables are in poor repair, and the entire place feels a little dirty. Seems quite popular with locals, but we probably won't be back.
